Author: Algorismus#9195
Content:
i want to set a 3 gpu rig to mine pirate, what port should i connect to?  the difficulty in port 2096 seems a little too high for 3 gtx 1060. Please help

GPU Port (diff 0.1): stratum+tcp://stratum.piratepool.io:2095
Multiple GPU Port (diff 10): stratum+tcp://stratum.piratepool.io:2096

Author: Algorismus#9195
Content:
Thanks @webworker01 
i also want to ask, how can i set the intensity to 50 on DSTM miner?

Author: Algorismus#9195
Content: i'm assuming the intensity value needs conversion when using dstm

Author: Algorismus#9195
Content:
there's an example for ewbf and bminer only on the getting started page. on the help menu of dstm i get the following values as example 0.9 and 0.85 seem waay to far from 50
#intensity=0:0.9,1:0.85       # Reduce the load which is put on the gpu valid
                              # range ]1.0-0.0[. Format: comma separated list
                              # of dev_id:intensity values e.g '0:0.893,2:0.8'

Author: Algorismus#9195
Content: sorry if i was unclear previously 😃

Author: Algorismus#9195
Content: @webworker01

Author: Algorismus#9195
Content: makes sens. so 50% should be .5

Author: Algorismus#9195
Content: right?

Author: Algorismus#9195
Content: thank you

Author: Algorismus#9195
Content: yes, dstm do not apply changes to all gpus by one command

Author: Algorismus#9195
Content: i have to set the intensity for each gpu

Author: Algorismus#9195
Content: yes, i agree. the dev team of dstm was doing an amazing job. i don't know why they abandoned the project

Author: Algorismus#9195
Content: there was no releases after v 6.0.2

Content: I'm trying to sync the RKT chain, any idea why it'd be stuck at block 331 (I understand this was the block sapling was implemented)

Content: I have updated to the 0.3.0 komodo daemon

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: RKT needs a different repo

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: using the normal release will make it stuck at 331, sapling activation

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: thanks 👌 might create another test chain on the komodo repo to test sapling pools

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: If I create an `-ac-private=1 `chain with the updated komodo daemon, will it be automatically start with sapling integration from block 1

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: no

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: sapling activation is around 1am Dec 15th UTC

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: copy, I see why i'd need the other repo now 😛

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: the only difference is the sapling activation timestamp in ~/komodo/src/komodo_defs.h

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: you can just change it to any timestamp to change when sapling activates

Author: NutellaLicka#4241
Content: So I'd have to ensure both nodes that start the chain had the same timestamp (say for in an hours time). Then I'd be able to create a chain with all sapling addresses

Author: jl777c#5810
Content: yes

Content:
edit `~/komodo/src/komodo_defs.h` file with the following timestamp and compile
```
#define KOMODO_SAPLING_ACTIVATION 1543073054 // Sat, 24 Nov 2018 15:24:14 GMT
#define KOMODO_SAPLING_DEADLINE 1543593600 // Fri, 30 Nov 2018 16:00:00 GMT
```
